title: Kendall Jenner 'earns more than Kylie' for sponsored Instagram posts
text:
Kendall’s reportedly a very bankable Instagram star (Picture: Kendall Jenner, Instagram)

Kylie Jenner may have more Instagram followers but it turns out her older sister Kendall Jenner earns more from paid posts, according to a new report.

A new list compiled by Buzz Bingo claims that Kendall, 24, is the highest-paid member of the family when it comes to sponsored posts on the photo-sharing platform.

Coming in at number three, the supermodel reportedly earns an estimated $16 million (£12.3 million) a year from brand deals paying her to plug their products on Instagram. It’s believed Kendall earns around $611,000 (£471,700) per paid post.

Some of Kendall’s most recent sponsored posts include an ad with Valentino, skincare brand Proactiv, Reserved, Aritzia and Stuart Weitzman – and that’s just in the past month so we’d love to see Kendall’s bank balance by Christmas.

Kendall has 117 million followers on the social media platform compared to her younger sister Kylie, who boasts 149 million.

Advertisement

Advertisement

It’s also less than their big sister Kim Kardashian, who just this week surpassed them all to reach 150 million followers, making her one of the most popular celebrities on Instagram. But surprisingly, the SKIMS founder is nowhere to be seen on the list.

Taking the top spot is Cristiano Ronaldo who reportedly earns an estimated $34 million (£26.2 million) a year from sponsored posts. If the 34-year-old feels like retiring early it seems he can survive off Instagram alone as Buzz Bingo claims his social media earnings are more than his income from football club Juventus.

Cristiano proudly holds the crown as the most followed celebrity on Instagram with a staggering 184 million accounts following his every move.

Elsewhere on the list is David Beckham at number four with $10.7 million (£8.2 million) per year, Selena Gomez at number five with $8 million (£6.1 million), Kylie with $3.8 million (£3 million) at number eight, and Khloe Kardashian rounding off the top 10 with a cool $1.2 million (£926,000) per year.

Highest-paid celebrities on Instagram

Cristiano Ronaldo

$47.8 million per year ($975,000 per post)

Lionel Messi

$23.3 million per year ($648,000 per post)

$15.9 million per year ($611,000 per post)

$10.7 million per year ($357,000 per post)

$8 million per year ($886,000 per post)

$7.2 million per year ($722,000 per post)

$4 million per year ($200,000 per post)

Kylie Jenner

$3.8 million per year ($1.27 million per post)

Ronaldinho

description: Kendall Jenner reportedly earns more for each paid post on Instagram than her younger sister Kylie Jenner.
